problem_text:
Do there exist infinite groups all of whose proper subgroups are cyclic of order p that do not satisfy any nontrivial group identity except xp = 1 and its consequences?
Note that there exist infinite groups all of whose proper subgroups are infinite cyclic that do not satisfy any nontrivial group identity (due to A. Olshanskii; see P. Zusmanovich, J. Algebra, 388 (2013), 268–286, Remark after Theorem 6.1).
P. Zusmanovich
